critique: The document pertains to the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933 and authorizes the Director of the United States Employment Service to accept voluntary services for occupational specifications and classifications. Given the context of the New Deal era, this suggests government intervention in the economy and labor markets. There is no information related to immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, or social inclusion. The ideological tilt is moderately liberal due to the interventionist nature of the act.
